items.title: AI stocks surge as Micron earnings fuel sector rally

featured_image.name: Micron stock soars on earnings beat amid 'unprecedented' AI-fueled demand for memory chips

items.description:
Artificial intelligence stocks surged Friday, driving major indexes higher and signaling renewed investor confidence in a sector that has weathered concerns over valuations and returns in recent weeks.

The tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite climbed approximately 1.2%, extending Thursday's 1.4% gain[1][2][3], while the S&P 500 rose 0.8%[3][4]. Semiconductor stocks led the advance, with the PHLX Semiconductor Sector Index jumping nearly 3%[5].

Micron Technology continued its rally, gaining more than 6% Friday after soaring 10% Thursday on earnings that crushed Wall Street expectations[1][2][6]. The memory chip maker reported adjusted earnings of $4.78 per share on revenue of $13.64 billion, well above estimates, and provided guidance of approximately $18.70 billion for the current quarter versus the $14.20 billion analysts expected[6][7]. "We are more than sold out," the company stated during its earnings call[7].

Oracle jumped about 8% after announcing it would join an investor group acquiring a 15% stake in TikTok's U.S. operations through a deal valued at approaching $10 billion[1][8]. The agreement allows the social media platform to continue operating in the United States while addressing national security concerns[8][9].

Nvidia gained approximately 3.6%, while Advanced Micro Devices climbed nearly 6%[1][10]. Other AI-related stocks including Super Micro Computer, Palantir Technologies, and Arista Networks also posted gains[5].

items.title: Oracle and Nvidia fuel tech rally on TikTok deal, China chip review

featured_image.name: Nvidia considers increasing H200 chip output due to robust China demand, Reuters sources say

items.description:
US stock markets rose Friday, with technology shares leading a rebound as Oracle and Nvidia surged on deal-making news and renewed artificial intelligence optimism, capping a volatile week on Wall Street.

The S&P 500 gained 0.89% to close at 6,835.14, while the Nasdaq Composite jumped 1.17% to 23,274.60[1][2][3]. The Dow Jones Industrial Average added 0.57%[2][3].

Oracle's stock soared more than 7% after TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew revealed the company signed agreements to create a US joint venture for the social media platform's American operations[4][5]. Under the deal, Oracle will hold a 15% stake alongside private equity firm Silver Lake and Abu Dhabi-based MGX, with the trio collectively owning 45% of the new entity set to take effect January 22, 2026[4][6]. Oracle will serve as the "trusted security partner" responsible for auditing compliance with national security terms[4].

Nvidia shares climbed 3.7% as the Trump administration initiated a review that could enable the chipmaker to sell its H200 AI processors to China[1][7]. The potential approval, which would come with a 25% government fee, reignited investor confidence in the AI sector after recent volatility over elevated valuations[8][9].

items.title: Grace Tame fights against a legal loophole frustrating abuse survivors
items.description: In every Australian state and the NT, churches cannot be held vicariously liable for historical child sexual abuse perpetrated by their priests. Grace Tame is leading the charge for change.

items.title: Extreme heat, humidity and storms ahead of Christmas Day
items.description: Australia is experiencing a smorgasbord of wild weather in the lead-up to Christmas, featuring extreme heat, humidity, severe thunderstorms, and tropical storms all on the cards.

items.title: Trump blames federal job cuts for rising unemployment

featured_image.name: < Federal agencies are rehiring workers and spending more after DOGE's push to cut

items.description:
President Donald Trump on Friday defended the rising unemployment rate, attributing the increase entirely to his administration's sweeping reductions in the federal workforce as he criticized media outlets for failing to provide what he called proper context[1][2].

In a Truth Social post, Trump said unemployment rose to 4.5% "only because we are reducing the Government Workforce by numbers that have never been seen before," adding that "100% OF OUR NEW JOBS ARE IN THE PRIVATE SECTOR"[3][4]. The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported the unemployment rate actually reached 4.6% in November, the highest level since September 2021[5][6][7].

items.title: How the Bondi shooters got access to now-banned guns
items.description: With Australia's strict gun laws, how was Sajid Akram able to legally own the gun he was using to slaughter innocent people in Bondi on December 14?

items.title: China weaponizes AI in cyberattacks on Western targets

featured_image.name: Anthropic warns of AI-driven hacking campaign linked to China

items.description:
Chinese state-sponsored hackers have weaponized artificial intelligence to conduct sophisticated cyberattacks against Western governments and corporations, marking a new phase in the escalating technological competition between Beijing and Washington.

On Thursday, nine U.S. lawmakers urged the Pentagon to add Chinese AI firm DeepSeek and other tech companies to a list of entities allegedly supporting China's military, intensifying scrutiny of Beijing's technology sector[1][2]. The move comes as tensions mount over China's use of advanced AI capabilities for both military and intelligence purposes.

items.title: As terror unfolded at Bondi, strangers were 'holding each other tight'
items.description: These are the stories of everyday people who stepped up during dark times, and of a community coming together when two gunmen sought to tear them apart on December 14.

items.title: How life has changed for one Jewish man in Australia
items.description: The rise in antisemitism in Australia since October 7 has reshaped the way Gaby Silver's family lives. After the Bondi attack, they're even more on edge.

items.title: Arizona scientists study microbes colonizing Icelandic lava

featured_image.name: Life on lava: How microbes colonize new habitats

items.description:
Scientists from the University of Arizona have documented how resilient microorganisms colonize fresh volcanic lava within hours, offering insights that could guide the search for ancient life on Mars.

The research team studied microbial communities on recently solidified lava flows from Iceland's Fagradalsfjall volcano, which erupted three times between 2021 and 2023. Their findings, published in Nature Communications Biology, reveal a predictable two-stage process of microbial succession on Earth's harshest new environments[1][2][3][4].

items.title: New York and Ontario partner on nuclear energy

featured_image.name: New York and Ontario sign agreement to bolster nuclear energy efforts

items.description:
New York Governor Kathy Hochul and Ontario Premier Doug Ford signed a landmark agreement Friday to jointly develop advanced nuclear energy technologies, marking a new era of cross-border energy cooperation amid rising demand for clean electricity and heightened trade tensions with the Trump administration[1][2][3][4].

The Memorandum of Understanding between the New York Power Authority and Ontario Power Generation establishes a framework for collaboration on both large-scale nuclear facilities and small modular reactors, which Ontario is currently building at the Darlington Nuclear Generating Station outside Toronto[1][3][5][4]. The deal aims to strengthen energy reliability, reduce costs, and accelerate decarbonization efforts in both regions[3][4].

items.title: 2025 space discoveries pave way for 2026 Moon missions

featured_image.name: 15 More of the Most Recent Space Discoveries from 2025

items.description:
As a rare interstellar comet makes its closest approach to Earth today, 2025 is culminating as one of the most productive years for space science, while 2026 promises historic aerospace achievements including the first crewed lunar mission in over half a century.

Comet 3I/ATLAS, detected by NASA's ATLAS telescope in Chile in July, passed within 168 million miles of Earth on December 19[1][2], marking only the third interstellar object ever discovered within our solar system. Multiple NASA missions, including Europa Clipper and Psyche, coordinated observations of this visitor traveling at 221,000 kilometers per hour[1][3].

items.title: Trump to announce drug price deals with pharma giants

featured_image.name: Trump unveils deal for AstraZeneca to cut Medicaid drug prices and join "TrumpRx" site

items.description:
President Donald Trump is set to announce deals with at least seven major pharmaceutical companies to lower prescription drug prices Friday afternoon at the White House, marking the latest expansion of his administration's "Most Favored Nation" pricing campaign.

GlaxoSmithKline, Merck, Sanofi, AbbVie, Bristol Myers Squibb, Gilead Sciences, Novartis, and Roche are among the companies expected to participate in the 1 p.m. briefing in the White House's Roosevelt Room, according to multiple sources[1][2][3]. The announcement comes after months of pressure from Trump, who in July sent letters to 17 pharmaceutical CEOs demanding they slash U.S. drug prices to match those overseas or face tariffs and other penalties[4][5].

items.title: Trump plan to dismantle Colorado climate center stalls funding

featured_image.name: Trump administration moves to dismantle prominent US weather ...abcnews.go.com › Politics › story

items.description:
President Donald Trump's plan to break up the National Center for Atmospheric Research in Boulder has stalled a major government funding package, as Colorado's senators demanded protections for the climate research hub they say is under retaliatory attack.

Democratic Senators Michael Bennet and John Hickenlooper placed a hold on a five-bill Senate appropriations package late Thursday, blocking progress on spending legislation just days before Congress began its year-end recess[1][2]. The move came three days after White House budget director Russell Vought announced the administration would dismantle NCAR, calling it "one of the largest sources of climate alarmism in the country"[3][4].

"President Trump is attacking Colorado because we refuse to bend to his corrupt administration," the senators said in a joint statement[1]. "We are holding the Senate's appropriations package to demand full funding for NCAR."

The standoff left lawmakers scrambling as they face a January 30 funding deadline[2]. Senate Appropriations Chair Susan Collins told reporters Thursday evening that only one hold remained on the package after weeks of negotiations with fiscal conservatives, identifying the Colorado senators as the final obstacle[2][5].

items.title: US to miss deadline to release all Epstein files, Trump official admits
items.description: Deputy Attorney-General Todd Blanche says several hundred thousand Epstein-related documents should be released by the legal deadline, but several hundred thousand more could be a "couple of weeks" away.

items.title: Morgan Stanley leads race to underwrite SpaceX IPO

featured_image.name: SpaceX’s Next Big Launch Could Be an I.P.O.

items.description:
Morgan Stanley is emerging as the front-runner to secure a key underwriting role in SpaceX's highly anticipated initial public offering, positioning itself ahead of rivals Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan in what could become one of the largest public listings in history, according to sources familiar with the matter[1][2][3].

The bank's long-standing relationship with SpaceX CEO Elon Musk, dating back at least 15 years, gives it a significant edge in the competitive selection process known as a "bake-off," three sources told Reuters[1][2]. However, no banks have been finalized, and it remains uncertain whether Morgan Stanley will secure the coveted "lead left" underwriting position[1][2].

items.title: Albanese has become the nation's lightning rod for Bondi accountability
items.description: While Albanese will forever struggle to shed the perception that he was too slow to recognise the threat to Australia's Jewish community — he is taking action.

items.title: Ex-Neighbours star Damien Richardson sentenced over Nazi gesture
items.description: Damien Richardson agreed to a restorative justice program, which will require him to apologise to the Jewish community and attend therapy.

items.title: Travball don't lie: Travis Head has become Australia's most beloved cricketer
items.description: Travis Head, last of the larrikins, is revelling in a summer of love as another glorious Ashes century guides his team ever closer to the urn.

items.title: EU to lend Ukraine $160b after plan to mobilise Russian assets unravels
items.description: EU leaders agree to provide a massive interest-free loan to Ukraine to meet its military and economic needs for the next two years after failing to reach an agreement on the use of frozen Russian assets.
